Introduction to BribeR

getting_started.Rmd

{BribeR} is an R package for working with structured transcript corpora and associated metadata. It provides functions to read, explore, and analyze transcripts from political and institutional datasets, with consistent formatting and integrated metadata to support reproducible workflows.

Installation 

# Install the released version from CRAN (if available)
install.packages("BribeR")

# Or install the development version from GitHub
remotes::install_github("agsotopl/BribeR")

Basic Usage

The package currently includes 3 main functions:

Function Description
read_transcripts() Read standardized transcript datasets
read_transcript_meta_data() Extract metadata for transcripts
run_transcript_network_app() Launch interactive network visualizer

The package also contains 3 support functions that allow users to access the raw transcript data directly:

Function Description
get_transcript_id() Get unique transcript IDs
get_transcript_speakers() List speakers for a transcript
get_transcripts_raw() Load raw transcript text

Example:

meta <- read_transcript_meta_data()
head(meta, 6)

Note: The get functions operate separately from the main functions, in that they access the raw data. The main functions are meant to access compilation RDA’s.

Example:

transcript_5 <- get_transcripts_raw(n = 5, combine = FALSE, package = "bribeR")

head(transcript_1)
